intro: Brachiaria prostrata, commonly known as匍匐牛筋草, is a low-growing, perennial grass native to tropical and subtropical regions. It has creeping stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread rapidly across the ground. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in forage and erosion control. Its botanical characteristics make it adaptable to various environmental conditions.
